dialogue: Uh hi, Diane and Mark Binder.
We're boring. Uh, Recently retired. From Shaker Heights. Mark's family was from here, down in Lublin, but left way before the war, the turn of the century.
We were Mayflower Jews, was always my little joke.

And we were always interested in seeing where they lived, what this place looked like. My family was French -- we were Fr ench Jews. And Mark and I have already been to Paris, so this was our next trip.
Yeah, not as glamorous, my side of the family. Sorry about that.
I don't think you'll find much suffering back there either.
Forgive me if I don't see this magical spark.
Mark, stop it. He's tormented, for whatever reason.
